intro: Prostanthera palustris, commonly known as swamp mint bush, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in wet or swampy habitats, such as riverbanks and wetlands. The plant features small, aromatic leaves with a mint-like scent, and its flowers are usually white or pale blue, arranged in clusters. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic properties. Prostanthera palustris plays an important role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and birds.
